raffadub wrote:
> Assuming there is a test function with several assertions; if one
> failes the assertions past it are not executed. Is there a way to get
> around this issue? More specifically; is it possible to execute all
> assertions in a test function despite some have failed.
> 
> I attempted using JFunc, but it is slightly incomplete. Other than
> this extension, I have had little luck finding anything else.

This is a FAQ, so search the web for more solutions. A summary:

  * JUnit wasn't designed to work that way.
  * If you want assertion #3 to evaluate even though #2 failed, then you 
probably have separate tests, so separate them.
  * You can get multiple failed assertions, but you have to fiddle with 
the framework or test runner to do it.
  * One of the other tools out there does it, but I don't know which one.

Someone will enthusiastically tell you how crappy JUnit is and that tool 
XYZ does what you want, if they haven't already.

Take care.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
